2844727237.resolved_title: The Verbatim Effect: People Remember Gist Better Than Details
2844727237.excerpt: The verbatim effect is a cognitive bias that causes people to remember the gist of information, which is its general meaning, better than they remember its exact form, which is the way the information was presented and the minor details that it involved.
